questions.question: Equipment used in this experiment is known as:
Which of these gives the value of clay content present in sand?

answers.c: Weight loss before and after the sample is dried

explanations.a: Clay content in sand is typically determined by measuring the weight loss of the sample before and after drying. Clay particles retain water more effectively than sand particles, so when a sand sample containing clay is dried, the clay particles lose their moisture content and thus lose weight. The weight loss between the wet and dried samples can be used to estimate the clay content present in the sand sample.
